case_vignette: a 15-year-old girl presents with patches of hair loss on her scalp that have been present for the last 6 months. she reports that her scalp is not itchy or painful and denies any recent illnesses, diet changes, or stressful life events. she does not have any other medical conditions and takes no medications. her uncle had a similar condition that started when he was in his 20s, but no one else in the family has experienced hair loss. the patient says she has not tried any treatments for the condition. on examination, she has several well-demarcated patches of hair loss on her frontal and parietal scalp, with no perifollicular erythema or scale.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have patches of hair loss on my scalp.
Have you noticed any scaling or itching associated with the hair loss areas?
No, my scalp is not itchy or painful, and there is no scaling.
How long have you been experiencing this hair loss?
I have been experiencing this hair loss for the last 6 months.
Do you have any history of similar issues, or do any family members have similar or related symptoms?
My uncle had a similar condition that started when he was in his 20s, but no one else in the family has experienced hair loss.
Are the patches of hair loss completely smooth, or can you see any stubs of hair breaking off?
The patches of hair loss are well-demarcated, but there is no detailed description about the smoothness or stubs of hair breaking off.
Do you have any other symptoms on your body, like similar patches of hair loss or changes in skin or nails?
No, I do not have any other medical conditions or symptoms on my body.
Final Diagnosis: Alopecia Areata
